metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8554 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in hw/pt-msi.c in Xen 4.6.x and earlier, when using the qemu-xen-traditional (aka qemu-dm) device model, allows local x86 HVM guest administrators to gain privileges by leveraging a system with access to a passed-through MSI-X capable physical PCI device and MSI-X table entries, related to a "write path."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
